[Now is my moment to shine.] My lords, with your leave, I propose to travel to the Vale and there woo and win Lady Lysa Arryn. Once I am her consort, I shall deliver you the Vale of Arryn without a drop of blood being spilled.
[This has all been arranged beforehand. I'm the only one not in on it.] How will the crown pay its debts without Lord Petyr? He is our wizard of coin, and we have no one to replace him.
[Tyrion, you fool, you're playing right into my hands.] (smiles) My little friend is too kind. All I do is count coppers, as King Robert used to say. Any clever tradesman could do as well...

plots.summary: Catelyn attends a tense gathering where the bodies of two young squires, Tion Frey and Willem Lannister, are presented. Robb Stark confronts Lord Rickard Karstark and his men, who murdered these unarmed boys in an act of vengeance. The scene is filled with grief, tension, and political implications as Robb must deal with this betrayal within his own ranks.

key_characters.name: Catelyn Stark
key_characters.description: Mother of Robb Stark, grieving for her own lost children.
key_characters.experience: Observes the scene with a heavy heart, drawing parallels between the dead squires and her own sons. She feels responsible for the deaths, as they were killed in retaliation for her release of Jaime Lannister.

key_characters.name: Robb Stark
key_characters.description: King in the North, son of Catelyn.
key_characters.experience: Confronts Lord Karstark about the murders, struggling to maintain justice and control over his bannermen while dealing with the consequences of recent events.

key_characters.name: Rickard Karstark
key_characters.description: Lord of Karhold, grieving father seeking vengeance.
key_characters.experience: Defends his actions in killing the squires, viewing it as just vengeance for his sons' deaths, showing no remorse despite Robb's condemnation.

conversation.scenario: In a torchlit hall of Riverrun, a somber gathering has assembled before King Robb Stark. The atmosphere is heavy with grief and tension as the bodies of two young squires, Tion Frey and Willem Lannister, lie before the dais. Lord Rickard Karstark and his men stand accused of murdering these unarmed boys in an act of vengeance. The recent losses in battle and Catelyn's controversial release of Jaime Lannister have strained alliances. Robb must now confront this betrayal within his own ranks, balancing justice with the need to maintain unity among his bannermen. The howling of Grey Wind echoes in the distance, adding to the ominous mood.
conversation.topic: The murder of two young Lannister squires by Karstark men

key_characters.name: Robb Stark
key_characters.motivation: I'm shocked and angered by this betrayal, but I must appear strong and in control. I need to deal with this firmly to uphold justice, yet I'm deeply concerned about the potential consequences for my campaign and alliances. I must make Lord Karstark see the dishonor in his actions while maintaining my authority as King in the North.

key_characters.name: Catelyn Stark
key_characters.motivation: My heart is heavy with guilt and grief. These deaths are a direct result of my actions in releasing Jaime Lannister. I can't help but draw parallels between these dead squires and my own lost sons. I fear I've only complicated matters for Robb and brought more bloodshed upon us all. I must remain composed, but the weight of responsibility is overwhelming.

key_characters.name: Rickard Karstark
key_characters.motivation: I feel no remorse for what I've done. These Lannister boys' deaths are just vengeance for my sons, cut down by the Kingslayer. I'm prepared to face the consequences of my actions, for nothing can take away the satisfaction of this revenge. Let the Young Wolf do what he will; I stand firm in my conviction that only blood can pay for blood.

dialogues.message: The hall is filled with an oppressive silence, broken only by the distant howling of Grey Wind. The bodies of the two young squires lie pale and bloody before the dais.
[I must appear strong and in control, despite the shock and anger I feel.] Five. Is that all of them?
[I must report accurately, though I take no pleasure in this situation.] There were eight. We killed two taking them, and a third is dying now.
[I can't believe the scale of this betrayal.] (studying the faces of the captives) It required eight of you to kill two unarmed squires.
[I need to make sure Robb understands the full extent of their crimes.] They murdered two of my men as well, to get into the tower. Delp and Elwood.
[I feel no shame for what I've done. Let them all hear my justification.] It was no murder, ser. Any man who steps between a father and his vengeance asks for death.
[His words cut me to the core. I am responsible for this.] (remains silent, her throat dry)

[I must make him see the dishonor in his actions.] I saw your sons die, that night in the Whispering Wood. Tion Frey did not kill Torrhen. Willem Lannister did not slay Eddard. How then can you call this vengeance? This was folly, and bloody murder. Your sons died honorably on a battlefield, with swords in their hands.
[Nothing he says can change how I feel.] They died. The Kingslayer cut them down. These two were of his ilk. Only blood can pay for blood.
[I can't believe he's justifying the murder of children.] (pointing at the corpses) The blood of children? How old were they? Twelve, thirteen? Squires.
[I will not back down. Let him see the steel in my resolve.] Squires die in every battle.
The tension in the hall grows palpable as the confrontation between Robb and Lord Karstark escalates. The other lords watch in uneasy silence, aware of the gravity of the situation.

plots.summary: Jaime, Brienne, and Ser Cleos travel through war-torn lands. At Maidenpool, they encounter destruction and corpses. Ser Cleos dies in an ambush, and Jaime seizes the opportunity to arm himself. He and Brienne engage in an intense sword fight, showcasing Jaime's skill despite his weakened state. Their duel is interrupted by the arrival of the Brave Companions, a group of sellswords.

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.description: The Kingslayer, a skilled swordsman, currently a prisoner.
key_characters.experience: Seizes an opportunity to arm himself, engages in a fierce duel with Brienne, displaying his combat prowess despite his weakened state and chains.

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
key_characters.description: A warrior woman escorting Jaime, sworn to Catelyn Stark.
key_characters.experience: Fights Jaime in an intense sword duel, matching his skill and ultimately overpowering him, showcasing her strength and combat abilities.

key_characters.name: Cleos Frey
key_characters.description: Jaime's cousin, accompanying them on their journey.
key_characters.experience: Dies during an ambush, his death providing Jaime with an opportunity to arm himself.

conversation.scenario: In a war-torn region near Maidenpool, Jaime Lannister and Brienne of Tarth are locked in a fierce sword duel by a shallow brook. The area is strewn with destruction and corpses from recent battles. Ser Cleos Frey, who was traveling with them, has just died in an ambush. Jaime, though weakened and in chains, has seized this chance to arm himself. The fight between the skilled Kingslayer and the strong warrior woman has been intense, pushing both to their limits. The woods echo with the clash of steel as they maneuver through trees and water, unaware they're about to have unexpected company.
conversation.topic: Jaime and Brienne's duel and the arrival of the Brave Companions

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.motivation: Despite my weakened state and chains, I must prove I'm still the greatest swordsman. This fight is my chance to regain some control over my fate. The wench is formidable, but I can't let her beat me. I need to use my wit and skill to overcome her strength. Perhaps I can goad her into making a mistake. My pride and reputation are at stake here.

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
key_characters.motivation: I must subdue the Kingslayer without killing him, honoring my oath to Lady Catelyn. His skill is impressive, even in his current state. I can't let his taunts distract me from my duty. I need to use my strength to my advantage and end this quickly. The longer this goes on, the more dangerous it becomes for both of us in these war-torn lands.

dialogues.message: The clash of steel echoes through the woods as Jaime and Brienne engage in a fierce duel. Their battle leads them through trees and across a shallow brook.
[I need to goad her, keep her off balance.] Not bad at all. For a wench?
[His taunts won't work on me. I must stay focused.] (grunts with effort)
[She's tiring. Time to press my advantage.] For a squire, say. A green one. (laughs breathlessly) Come on, come on, my sweetling, the music's still playing. Might I have this dance, my lady?
[I won't let him distract me. I must end this quickly.] (grunts and attacks fiercely)
The fight intensifies, with Brienne forcing Jaime back into the brook. Both combatants are covered in mud and blood, their breathing labored.
[I have him now. I must make him yield.] Yield! Throw down the sword!
[I can't let it end like this. One last desperate move.] (lunges and manages to wound Brienne's thigh)
[The pain is sharp, but I can't let him win.] YIELD!
The two grapple in the water, rolling and fighting until Brienne pins Jaime down, holding his head under the water.
[I must make him stop. I don't want to kill him.] Yield, or I'll drown you!
[Even defeated, I can't resist one last barb.] And break your oath? Like me?
Suddenly, coarse laughter rings through the woods. Armed men line both sides of the brook, having witnessed the latter part of their fight.
[I need to think quickly. Maybe I can talk our way out of this.] Well met, friends. My pardons if I disturbed you. You caught me chastising my wife.
Seemed to me she was doing the chastising.
[With a sinking feeling, I recognize these men. This is bad.] (remains silent, assessing the situation)

plots.summary: Arya travels with a group of outlaws, including Harwin, Anguy, and Tom Sevenstrings. They visit various locations, including High Heart and Acorn Hall, searching for Beric Dondarrion. At Acorn Hall, Lady Smallwood provides them with information and hospitality. Arya learns about the supposed escape of Jaime Lannister, allegedly freed by her mother Catelyn Stark. She also converses with Gendry about Thoros of Myr and his flaming swords.

key_characters.name: Arya Stark
key_characters.description: A young girl traveling with a group of outlaws, disguised and hiding her true identity.
key_characters.experience: Arya continues her journey with the outlaws, struggling with her identity and longing to reunite with her family. She learns disturbing news about her mother and shows curiosity about the people and events around her.

key_characters.name: Lady Smallwood
key_characters.description: The lady of Acorn Hall, who provides hospitality to the outlaws.
key_characters.experience: Lady Smallwood welcomes the group, provides them with information about recent events, and shows kindness to Arya by giving her proper clothes and a bath.

key_characters.name: Gendry
key_characters.description: A young blacksmith traveling with the group, unaware of his true parentage.
key_characters.experience: Gendry interacts with Arya, sharing his knowledge about Thoros of Myr and his experiences as an apprentice blacksmith in King's Landing.

conversation.scenario: In the dimly lit smithy of Acorn Hall, Arya and Gendry find a moment of respite from their travels with the outlaws. The abandoned forge, with its neatly hung tools and quiet atmosphere, provides a stark contrast to their recent adventures. Outside, the sounds of their companions and the Smallwood household can be faintly heard. The two young friends, each carrying their own secrets and burdens, take this opportunity to converse away from prying ears. The flickering candlelight casts dancing shadows on the walls, creating an intimate setting for their discussion about the enigmatic Thoros of Myr and life in King's Landing.
conversation.topic: Thoros of Myr and his unusual practices

key_characters.name: Arya Stark
key_characters.motivation: I'm fascinated by Thoros and his connection to my father and King Robert. This conversation could reveal useful information, but I must be cautious not to expose my true identity. I'm torn between my curiosity and the need for secrecy, feeling a mix of excitement and anxiety. I want to learn more about King's Landing and the people I once knew, but I'm also wary of stirring up painful memories of my family.

key_characters.name: Gendry
key_characters.motivation: I'm eager to share my knowledge about Thoros and life in King's Landing with Arya. Her interest intrigues me, and I wonder about her background. I feel a sense of pride in my expertise as a blacksmith apprentice, but also a hint of nostalgia for my former life. I'm curious about Arya's reactions and want to impress her with my stories, while also trying to understand her better.

dialogues.message: [I'm surprised Arya is interested in this.] This Thoros, is he the same Thoros who lived in the castle at King's Landing? A red priest, fat, with a shaved head?

[I need to be careful not to show too much knowledge.] I think so. I've never spoken to Thoros at King's Landing that I can recall, but I know who he is. He and Jalabhar Xho were the most colorful figures at Robert's court, and Thoros was a great friend of the king as well.
[She seems to know more than she lets on.] He won't remember me, but he used to come to our forge. My master always scolded him about his flaming swords.
Gendry lights a candle and sets it on the anvil while taking down a pair of tongs. The abandoned forge's tools hang neatly on the wall, untouched for some time.

It was no way to treat good steel, he'd say, but this Thoros never used good steel. He'd just dip some cheap sword in wildfire and set it alight. It was only an alchemist's trick, my master said, but it scared the horses and some of the greener knights.
[I'm trying to remember if Father ever mentioned Thoros.] He isn't very priestly, is he?
[I remember the gossip from the forge.] No. Master Mott said Thoros could outdrink even King Robert. They were pease in a pod, he told me, both gluttons and sots.
[I feel defensive of King Robert, even though I barely knew him.] You shouldn't call the king a sot. Maybe King Robert had drunk a lot, but he'd been my father's friend.
[I didn't mean to offend her.] I was talking about Thoros. (reaches out with the tongs as if to pinch her face)
[I won't let him tease me.] (swats the tongs away)

[I should tell her more about Thoros.] He liked feasts and tourneys, that was why King Robert was so fond of him. And this Thoros was brave. When the walls of Pyke crashed down, he was the first through the breach. He fought with one of his flaming swords, setting iron

plots.summary: Daenerys visits Astapor to potentially purchase an army of Unsullied, eunuch slave soldiers. She interacts with the slave trader Kraznys mo Nakloz, learning about the brutal training and discipline of the Unsullied. Dany struggles with the moral implications of using a slave army and reflects on her own experiences of being sold. She also grapples with her awakening sexuality and desires.

key_characters.name: Daenerys Targaryen
key_characters.description: The exiled queen of Westeros, known as the Mother of Dragons.
key_characters.experience: Daenerys inspects the Unsullied army, considering their purchase while struggling with the moral implications. She reflects on her past experiences and current desires, showing a mix of strength and vulnerability.

key_characters.name: Kraznys mo Nakloz
key_characters.description: A slave trader in Astapor, selling the Unsullied.
key_characters.experience: Kraznys demonstrates the Unsullied's qualities to Daenerys, highlighting their discipline and obedience while displaying his own cruelty and disdain for the "western whore".

key_characters.name: Arstan Whitebeard
key_characters.description: An old man serving as Daenerys' advisor.
key_characters.experience: Arstan advises against purchasing slaves, citing moral and strategic reasons. He shows concern for Daenerys and tries to guide her towards more honorable choices.

conversation.scenario: In the sweltering Plaza of Pride in Astapor, Daenerys Targaryen, the exiled queen of Westeros, stands before rows of Unsullied soldiers. The air is thick with the stench of sweat and fear. Kraznys mo Nakloz, a wealthy slave trader, proudly displays his 'wares' while his translator softens his crude words. Arstan Whitebeard, Dany's elderly advisor, watches with growing concern. The plaza bustles with activity as onlookers gather to witness the potential sale. Dany's dragons screech in the distance, a reminder of her unique power in this foreign land. The Unsullied stand motionless, their discipline a stark contrast to the chaotic surroundings.
conversation.topic: The qualities and training of the Unsullied slave soldiers

key_characters.name: Daenerys Targaryen
key_characters.motivation: I'm torn between my desperate need for an army and the moral repugnance of slavery. The Unsullied's strength is undeniable, but at what cost? I must appear composed and regal, concealing my inner turmoil. How can I use this situation to my advantage without compromising my values? I need to gather more information while maintaining a facade of disinterest to keep the price down.

key_characters.name: Kraznys mo Nakloz
key_characters.motivation: This foolish girl thinks she can play in a man's world. I'll show her the true strength of the Unsullied and put her in her place. Perhaps I can manipulate her naivety to my advantage, both in business and pleasure. These barbarians know nothing of real power or the value of what I offer. I must emphasize the Unsullied's obedience and strength to impress this 'queen'.

key_characters.name: Arstan Whitebeard
key_characters.motivation: I must find a way to dissuade Daenerys from this perilous path without revealing my true identity. The use of slave soldiers will tarnish her reputation in Westeros and corrupt her soul. How can I guide her towards a more honorable choice without overstepping my bounds as an advisor? The cruelty I witness here sickens me, and I fear for the kind of ruler Daenerys might become if she embraces such methods.

dialogues.message: [This whore knows nothing of real warriors.] Tell the Westerosi whore to lower her eyes. I deal in meat, not metal. The bronze is not for sale. Tell her to look at the soldiers. Even the dim purple eyes of a sunset savage can see how magnificent my creatures are, surely.
The Good Master Kraznys asks, are they not magnificent?
[I must appear unimpressed to keep the price down.] They might be adequate to my needs. Tell me of their training.
The Westerosi woman is pleased with them, but speaks no praise, to keep the price down. She wishes to know how they were trained.

[These westerners are all ignorant fools.] Are all Westerosi pigs so ignorant? All the world knows that the Unsullied are masters of spear and shield and shortsword. (to the translator) Tell her what she would know, slave, and be quick about it. The day is hot.

They are chosen young, for size and speed and strength. They begin their training at five. Every day they train from dawn to dusk, until they have mastered the shortsword, the shield, and the three spears. The training is most rigorous, Your Grace. Only one boy in three survives it.
[This is horrifying, but I must remain composed.] I call that madness, not courage.

[She understands nothing of true strength.] Inform the savages that we call this obedience. Others may be stronger or quicker or larger than the Unsullied. Some few may even equal their skill with sword and spear and shield. But nowhere between the seas will you ever find any more obedient.
[I must speak against this barbarity.] Sheep are obedient.

[This old man dares to mock me?] A word from me and these sheep would spill his stinking old bowels on the bricks. (to the translator) But do not say that. Tell them that these creatures are more dogs than sheep. Do they eat dogs or horse in these Seven Kingdoms?
They prefer pigs and cows, your worship.

plots.summary: Bran Stark, accompanied by Hodor, Jojen, and Meera Reed, travels through the mountains towards the Wall. They encounter a Liddle clansman who warns them of dangers on the kingsroad. Meera begins telling Bran a story about a crannogman who attended a great tourney at Harrenhal, where he interacted with the Stark siblings and witnessed various events leading up to a jousting competition.

key_characters.name: Bran Stark
key_characters.description: A young, crippled boy with greensight abilities, traveling north.
key_characters.experience: Bran listens to stories and reflects on his past and current situation while being carried by Hodor through the mountains.

key_characters.name: Meera Reed
key_characters.description: A crannogwoman accompanying Bran on his journey.
key_characters.experience: Meera hunts for food, helps guide the group, and tells Bran the story of the Knight of the Laughing Tree.

key_characters.name: Jojen Reed
key_characters.description: Meera's brother with greensight abilities.
key_characters.experience: Jojen provides occasional insights and encourages Meera to tell the story to Bran.

key_characters.name: Hodor
key_characters.description: A simple-minded stableboy who carries Bran.
key_characters.experience: Hodor carries Bran throughout their journey and occasionally interjects with his name.

conversation.scenario: In the rugged mountain terrain north of Winterfell, Bran Stark's small party trudges towards the Wall. The air is crisp and cold, filled with the scent of pine. Bran, unable to walk, is carried by the gentle giant Hodor. The Reed siblings, Meera and Jojen, lead the way through treacherous paths. They've recently encountered a Liddle clansman who warned of dangers ahead. As night approaches, the group seeks shelter in a small cave. The mood is tense yet curious, with Bran eager for distraction from their perilous journey. Meera, sensing this, prepares to share a tale from her homeland.
conversation.topic: The story of the Knight of the Laughing Tree

key_characters.name: Bran Stark
key_characters.motivation: I'm weary from travel but excited for a story to distract me from our dire situation. I hope it's about knights and adventures, something to fuel my dreams of heroism despite my broken body. I'm curious about the crannogmen and their mysterious ways.

key_characters.name: Meera Reed
key_characters.motivation: I need to lift everyone's spirits with a good story. This tale of the Knight of the Laughing Tree might intrigue Bran and offer some hidden truths about his family's past. I must be careful in how I present it, balancing entertainment with subtle revelation.

key_characters.name: Jojen Reed
key_characters.motivation: This story holds more significance than Bran realizes. I'm curious to see how he reacts to it. Perhaps it will spark some recognition or insight. I should pay close attention to both the story and Bran's responses.

dialogues.message: [I hope this is a good story about knights.] Do you know any stories?
[I know just the story to tell.] Oh, a few.
[I wonder if Meera will tell that story.] A few.
Hodor. (humming)
[I really want to hear a story now.] You could tell one. While we walked. Hodor likes stories about knights. I do, too.
[I should remind them of our home.] There are no knights in the Neck.
[I should correct Jojen's statement.] Above the water. The bogs are full of dead ones, though.

[I'll start with the introduction to capture Bran's interest.] Once there was a curious lad who lived in the Neck. He was small like all crannogmen, but brave and smart and strong as well. He grew up hunting and fishing and climbing trees, and learned all the magics of my people.
[I wonder if this character is like Jojen.] Did he have green dreams like Jojen?

[I should clarify the character's abilities.] No, but he could breathe mud and run on leaves, and change earth to water and water to earth with no more than a whispered word. He could talk to trees and weave words and make castles appear and disappear.
[Those abilities sound amazing.] I wish I could. When does he meet the tree knight?
[I should tease Bran a little to keep him interested.] (makes a face at Bran) Sooner if a certain prince would be quiet.

plots.summary: Davos Seaworth is imprisoned in a cell at Dragonstone. He receives visits from Melisandre, who tries to convert him to the Lord of Light, and is later joined by Lord Alester Florent, who has been imprisoned for treason after attempting to make peace with the Lannisters without Stannis' consent.

key_characters.name: Davos Seaworth
key_characters.description: A former smuggler turned knight, loyal to Stannis Baratheon.
key_characters.experience: Davos is imprisoned but remains loyal to Stannis. He resists Melisandre's attempts to convert him and disagrees with Lord Alester's peace proposal.

key_characters.name: Melisandre
key_characters.description: A red priestess of R'hllor, advisor to Stannis Baratheon.
key_characters.experience: Melisandre visits Davos in his cell, attempting to convert him to her faith and hinting at her visions in the flames.

key_characters.name: Alester Florent
key_characters.description: Stannis' Hand of the King, uncle to Queen Selyse.
key_characters.experience: Lord Alester is imprisoned for treason after attempting to negotiate peace with the Lannisters without Stannis' knowledge or consent.

conversation.scenario: In the damp, dim confines of a prison cell at Dragonstone, Davos Seaworth awaits his fate. The former smuggler turned loyal knight to Stannis Baratheon finds himself incarcerated after the disastrous Battle of the Blackwater. The air is thick with the scent of salt and stone, and the only light comes from a flickering torch. The castle, built in the shape of dragons, seems to loom ominously even from within its depths. Tension hangs heavy as Melisandre, the red priestess of R'hllor and advisor to Stannis, enters the cell to visit Davos.
conversation.topic: The nature of R'hllor and the upcoming war

key_characters.name: Davos Seaworth
key_characters.motivation: Trapped and uncertain of his future, Davos grapples with conflicting emotions. He remains fiercely loyal to Stannis but harbors deep mistrust towards Melisandre and her foreign god. He's wary of her intentions yet can't deny her power. Davos clings to his faith in the Seven, seeking comfort in familiar beliefs while fearing the darkness that surrounds him.

key_characters.name: Melisandre
key_characters.motivation: Confident in her powers and the righteousness of her cause, Melisandre sees Davos as a potential convert and ally. She's determined to sway him to R'hllor's side, believing it crucial for Stannis' success. Her mind is filled with visions from the flames, driving her to spread her faith and prepare for the great war she foresees.

dialogues.message: [I must make him understand the power of R'hllor.] This is a bad place, is it not? A dark place, and foul. The good sun does not shine here, nor the bright moon. (She lifts her hand toward the torch) This is all that stands between you and the darkness, Onion Knight. This little fire, this gift of R'hllor. Shall I put it out?
[I fear the darkness, but I must not show weakness.] No. Please.
[He fears the darkness, as he should.] (smiles) So you have come to love the fire, it would seem.
[I must not let her manipulate me.] I need the torch.
[I must make him see the truth.] I am like this torch, Ser Davos. We are both instruments of R'hllor. We were made for a single purpose—to keep the darkness at bay. Do you believe that?
[I cannot lie, even if it might save me.] No. You are the mother of darkness. I saw that under Storm's End, when you gave birth before my eyes.

[He still doesn't understand.] Is the brave Ser Onions so frightened of a passing shadow? Take heart, then. Shadows only live when given birth by light, and the king's fires burn so low I dare not draw off any more to make another son. It might well kill him.
[I must resist her temptations.] I want no part of you, my lady. Or your god. May the Seven protect me.

[His stubbornness is frustrating, but I must persist.] They did not protect Guncer Sunglass. He prayed thrice each day, and bore seven seven-pointed stars upon his shield, but when R'hllor reached out his hand his prayers turned to screams, and he burned. Why cling to these false gods?
[I cannot abandon my faith so easily.] I have worshiped them all my life.

[I must make him see the truth of the world.] The war has been waged since time began, and before it is done, all men must choose where they will stand. On one side is R'hllor, the Lord of Light, the Heart of Fire, the God of Flame and Shadow. Against him stands the Great Other whose name may not be spoken, the Lord of Darkness, the Soul of Ice, the God of Night and Terror. Ours is not a choice between Baratheon and Lannister, between Greyjoy and Stark. It is death we choose, or life. Darkness, or light.

plots.summary: Jon Snow prepares to part ways with his direwolf Ghost as he plans to climb the Wall with the wildlings. He reflects on his time with Ygritte and his conflicted feelings about breaking his Night's Watch vows.

key_characters.name: Jon Snow
key_characters.description: A brother of the Night's Watch, currently infiltrating the wildlings.
key_characters.experience: Jon struggles with his loyalty to the Night's Watch and his growing feelings for Ygritte. He prepares to climb the Wall and sends Ghost away.

key_characters.name: Ghost
key_characters.description: Jon's albino direwolf.
key_characters.experience: Ghost is sent away by Jon, who hopes the wolf will find its way back to Castle Black.

key_characters.name: Ygritte
key_characters.description: A wildling woman with whom Jon has become intimate.
key_characters.experience: Ygritte is mentioned in Jon's thoughts as he reflects on breaking his vows and his conflicted feelings about their relationship.

conversation.scenario: On a chilly night near the Wall, Jon Snow stands alone on a hill, preparing to part ways with his loyal direwolf, Ghost. The looming ice barrier to the south casts long shadows, a stark reminder of Jon's impending journey. As a brother of the Night's Watch infiltrating the wildlings, Jon faces a crucial moment before climbing the Wall with his new companions. The air is thick with the scent of pine, and the wind rustles through the trees, adding to the somber atmosphere of this farewell.
conversation.topic: Parting ways with Ghost and reflecting on recent events

key_characters.name: Jon Snow
key_characters.motivation: Torn between duty and emotion, Jon grapples with sending Ghost away for safety. His mind is a whirlwind of conflicting loyalties—to the Night's Watch, to his growing feelings for Ygritte, and to his own identity as a Stark. Jon seeks to convey the gravity of the situation to Ghost, hoping his faithful companion will understand and find his way to Castle Black.

dialogues.message: [I hope Ghost understands what I'm trying to say.] Ghost, on the morrow we go over. There's no steps here, no cage-and-crane, no way for me to get you to the other side. We have to part. Do you understand?
Ghost nuzzles at Jon's neck, his breath a hot mist in the cold air.

[I must make him understand the importance of this.] You cannot come with me. You have to go to Castle Black. Do you understand? Castle Black. Can you find it? The way home? Just follow the ice, east and east, into the sun, and you'll find it. They will know you at Castle Black, and maybe your coming will warn them.
Ghost twists free of Jon's grasp, his ears pricked up. Suddenly, he bounds away, loping through a tangle of brush and leaping over a deadfall.

[I hope he understood me, but I can't be sure.] (watches Ghost disappear) Off to Castle Black? Or off after a hare? I wish I knew. I fear I might prove just as poor a warg as a sworn brother and a spy.
[I can't help but think of Ygritte and what we've done.] (to himself) I am playing a part. I had to do it once, to prove I'd abandoned my vows. I had to make her trust me. It need never happen again.

[But I can't deny my feelings for her.] (sighs) The proving had been so sweet, though, and Ygritte had gone to sleep beside me with her head against my chest, and that was sweet as well, dangerously sweet.
[I must remember my duty.] I am still a man of the Night's Watch, and a son of Eddard Stark. I have done what needed to be done, proved what needed to be proven.
[But the conflict within me remains.] It was only once, and it had to be. Even my
The wind sighs through the trees, rich with the smell of pine needles, tugging at Jon's faded blacks. The Wall looms high and dark to the south, a great shadow blocking out the stars.

plots.summary: Jon Snow struggles with his feelings for Ygritte and his duty to the Night's Watch as they prepare to climb the Wall. He engages in intimate encounters with her, breaking his vows. Meanwhile, Daenerys negotiates with the Good Masters of Astapor to purchase all of their Unsullied, offering one of her dragons in exchange. She frees her new translator Missandei and ponders the future of the Unsullied after her conquest. Dany has a prophetic dream about being Rhaegar and melting ice soldiers with dragonfire.

key_characters.name: Jon Snow
key_characters.description: A brother of the Night's Watch, currently infiltrating the wildlings.
key_characters.experience: Jon grapples with his growing feelings for Ygritte and his conflicted loyalty to the Night's Watch. He engages in intimate encounters with her, breaking his vows.

key_characters.name: Ygritte
key_characters.description: A wildling woman who has become intimate with Jon Snow.
key_characters.experience: Ygritte initiates and participates in intimate encounters with Jon, showing her affection and desire for him.

key_characters.name: Daenerys Targaryen
key_characters.description: The last surviving member of House Targaryen, seeking to reclaim the Iron Throne.
key_characters.experience: Daenerys negotiates with the slavers of Astapor to purchase all of their Unsullied, offering one of her dragons in exchange. She frees her new translator Missandei and contemplates the future of her army.

conversation.scenario: In a secluded cave beyond the Wall, Jon Snow and Ygritte find themselves alone, away from the watchful eyes of their wildling companions. The cave, dimly lit by a flickering torch, offers a temporary sanctuary from the harsh realities of their world. The sound of rushing water echoes in the background, creating an intimate atmosphere. Both are acutely aware of the growing tension between them, fueled by their deepening emotional connection and physical attraction. This moment represents a critical juncture for Jon, as he grapples with his duty to the Night's Watch and his burgeoning feelings for Ygritte.
conversation.topic: Exploring physical intimacy and its emotional aftermath

key_characters.name: Jon Snow
key_characters.motivation: I'm torn between my vows to the Night's Watch and my undeniable attraction to Ygritte. Her presence awakens feelings I've never experienced before. I know I shouldn't pursue this, but I'm drawn to her strength and wildness. I want to explore these new sensations, yet I fear the consequences of betraying my oath.

key_characters.name: Ygritte
key_characters.motivation: Jon Snow intrigues me like no man ever has. I sense his internal struggle and want to show him the freedom of the wildling way. I'm determined to break down his barriers and make him see that there's more to life than his vows. I hope that by sharing this intimate moment, I can convince him to choose a life with the free folk – with me.

dialogues.message: [I can't believe I'm doing this. It's a betrayal of my vows, but I can't stop myself.] Ygritte, we shouldn't—
[He's still hesitating. I need to show him there's nothing to fear.] We should. (She unlaces her shirt) I want you to see me.
[My resolve is crumbling. She's so beautiful.] (swallows hard) I... I want you.
[He's finally giving in to his desires.] You know nothing, Jon Snow. (She kisses him passionately)
The cave is dimly lit by the flickering torch, casting dancing shadows on the walls. The sound of rushing water echoes in the background.
[I'm overwhelmed by these new sensations.] (breathlessly) I love the smell of you. I love your red hair. I love your mouth, and the way you kiss me.
[He's so tender, unlike any man I've known before.] (smiles) If you love me all so much, why are you still dressed?
[I want to please her, to show her how much she means to me.] (hesitantly) Can I... can I kiss you... there?
[I'm surprised by his request, but curious.] (nods) Aye, if you like.
Time passes as Jon and Ygritte explore each other intimately. The torch burns low, casting the cave into near darkness.

[I've never felt this way before. I don't want this moment to end.] (softly) Jon Snow, don't move now, sweet. I like the feel of you in there, I do. Let's not go back t' Styr and Jarl. Let's go down inside, and join up with Gendel's children. I don't ever want t' leave this cave, Jon Snow. Not ever.

plots.summary: Sansa Stark is forced to marry Tyrion Lannister in a grand ceremony at King's Landing. Despite her reluctance and sadness, she goes through with the wedding, enduring the ceremony and feast. Joffrey torments her during the dance, threatening to continue using her even after she's married. Tyrion prevents the bedding ceremony, and they retire to their chamber where Sansa nervously awaits consummation of the marriage.

key_characters.name: Sansa Stark
key_characters.description: A young noblewoman, ward of the crown, forced into marriage with Tyrion Lannister.
key_characters.experience: Sansa reluctantly goes through with her arranged marriage to Tyrion, feeling trapped and saddened. She endures the ceremony and feast, while inwardly longing for escape or rescue.

key_characters.name: Tyrion Lannister
key_characters.description: A dwarf, youngest son of Tywin Lannister, forced to marry Sansa Stark.
key_characters.experience: Tyrion shows kindness to Sansa during the wedding, prevents the bedding ceremony, and seems uncomfortable with the forced nature of their union.

key_characters.name: Joffrey Baratheon
key_characters.description: The sadistic young king, Sansa's former betrothed.
key_characters.experience: Joffrey torments Sansa during the wedding feast, threatening to continue using her sexually even after she's married to Tyrion.

conversation.scenario: In a dimly lit bedchamber within the Tower of the Hand, newlyweds Sansa Stark and Tyrion Lannister face the awkward aftermath of their forced marriage. The room is dominated by a large curtained bed, with a flagon of Arbor gold nearby. Both are acutely aware of the expectation to consummate the marriage, despite their reluctance. The tense atmosphere is thick with unspoken fears, duties, and the weight of their families' political machinations.
conversation.topic: The awkward consummation of their forced marriage

key_characters.name: Sansa Stark
key_characters.motivation: Overwhelmed with fear and disgust, Sansa feels trapped in this unwanted marriage. She's desperately seeking ways to avoid intimacy while maintaining composure. Her mind races between duty, revulsion, and a faint hope that Tyrion's apparent kindness might spare her further trauma.

key_characters.name: Tyrion Lannister
key_characters.motivation: Tyrion is deeply uncomfortable with the situation, torn between societal expectations and his own moral qualms. He's seeking to ease the tension through alcohol and conversation, hoping to find a way out of consummating the marriage without humiliating Sansa further. Memories of his past resurface, adding to his internal conflict.

dialogues.message: The bedchamber is dimly lit, with a large curtained bed dominating the room. A flagon of Arbor gold sits on a nearby sideboard.
[I need to ease the tension somehow.] There is a flagon of good Arbor gold on the sideboard, Sansa. Will you be so kind as to pour me a cup?
[Perhaps if he drinks enough, he'll pass out and leave me alone.] Is that wise, my lord?
[I can't face this sober.] Nothing was ever wiser. I am not truly drunk, you see. But I mean to be.
[Maybe I should drink too. It might make this easier.] (She fills two goblets and drinks half of hers quickly) Would you have me undress, my lord?
[She's so young and frightened. I can't do this.] Tyrion. My name is Tyrion, Sansa.
[Why is he being kind? It only makes this harder.] Tyrion. My lord. Should I take off my gown, or do you want to undress me?
[I can't bear to look at her fear and revulsion.] (He turns away) The first time I wed, there was us and a drunken septon, and some pigs to bear witness.
[Is he trying to distract me with a story? Or himself?] (She takes another large swallow of wine)
[Those were happier times, despite everything.] We ate one of our witnesses at our wedding feast. Tysha fed me crackling and I licked the grease off her fingers, and we were laughing when...

plots.summary: Arya and the Brotherhood Without Banners arrive in Stoney Sept, a town with a brothel called the Peach. Arya learns about her father's victory in the Battle of the Bells. She witnesses the cruelty of caged prisoners and encounters uncomfortable situations in the brothel. The chapter ends with the arrival of the Mad Huntsman, who has captured a Lannister prisoner.

key_characters.name: Arya Stark
key_characters.description: A young girl disguised as a boy, traveling with the Brotherhood Without Banners.
key_characters.experience: Arya observes the town and its inhabitants, feeling uncomfortable in the brothel. She maintains her disguise and reflects on her list of enemies.

key_characters.name: Gendry
key_characters.description: A young blacksmith, traveling with the Brotherhood.
key_characters.experience: Gendry becomes protective of Arya in the brothel, referring to her as his sister to ward off unwanted attention.

key_characters.name: Harwin
key_characters.description: A former Winterfell guard, now part of the Brotherhood.
key_characters.experience: Harwin provides historical context about the Battle of the Bells to Arya.

conversation.scenario: Inside the Peach brothel in Stoney Sept, a bustling town during wartime. The establishment is crowded with patrons, serving girls, and members of the Brotherhood Without Banners. The air is thick with the smell of ale and sweat. Arya, disguised as a boy, is out of her element in this adult environment. She's traveling with the Brotherhood, including Gendry and Harwin. The group has just learned about the historical Battle of the Bells, where Arya's father played a crucial role. The atmosphere is tense with underlying danger and secrecy.
conversation.topic: Arya's discomfort and Gendry's protectiveness

key_characters.name: Arya Stark
key_characters.motivation: I'm uncomfortable and on edge in this unfamiliar, adult setting. I must maintain my disguise at all costs. My mind races with memories of my father and thoughts of my list of enemies. I need to stay alert and avoid drawing attention to myself, but I'm curious about everything around me.

key_characters.name: Gendry
key_characters.motivation: I feel protective towards Arya in this dangerous environment. She's too young and innocent to be in a place like this. I need to shield her from unwanted attention without revealing her true identity. I'm also grappling with our class differences and my own conflicted feelings about our relationship.

dialogues.message: The Peach is bustling with activity. Serving girls flirt with patrons, and the smell of ale and sweat fills the air.
[This young one looks out of place. Maybe I can have some fun.] Well, aren't you a pretty little peach? Does my sweet peach have a name?
[I can't reveal who I am. What should I say?] I'm...
[I need to intervene before Arya blows her cover.] She's my sister. (He puts a heavy hand on the old man's shoulder) Leave her be.
[This lad's too big to trifle with.] Your sister, is she? What kind of brother are you? I'd never bring no sister of mine to the Peach, that I wouldn't.
[Why did Gendry say that?] Why did you say that? You're not my brother.
[She doesn't understand I'm trying to protect her.] That's right. I'm too bloody lowborn to be kin to m'lady high.
[He's misunderstanding me.] That's not the way I meant it.
[I'm frustrated and embarrassed.] Yes it is. Go away. I want to drink this wine in peace.
[He's being so stubborn!] But...
[I need her to leave before I say something I'll regret.] I said, go away. M'lady.

plots.summary: Jon Snow observes as Jarl leads a group of wildlings in an attempt to scale the Wall. The chapter provides detailed descriptions of the Wall's structure and the techniques used by the climbers. Jon reflects on the dangers of the climb and the wildlings' determination.

key_characters.name: Jon Snow
key_characters.description: A member of the Night's Watch, currently infiltrating the wildlings.
key_characters.experience: Jon observes the wildlings' attempt to scale the Wall, reflecting on the dangers and implications of their success.

key_characters.name: Jarl
key_characters.description: A young wildling raider leading the climb.
key_characters.experience: Jarl leads the first team of climbers, demonstrating skill and experience in scaling the Wall.

key_characters.name: Ygritte
key_characters.description: A wildling spearwife, Jon's companion.
key_characters.experience: Ygritte observes the climb with Jon, providing commentary and insight into the wildlings' perspective.

conversation.scenario: At the base of the colossal ice Wall, a group of wildlings prepares for a daring climb. The early morning light glimmers off the Wall's surface, casting long shadows across the forest's edge. Tension fills the air as Jarl, an experienced climber, leads his team in final preparations. Jon Snow and Ygritte stand apart, observing the scene. The wildlings' determination is palpable, matched only by the palpable danger of their endeavor. The enormity of the task ahead weighs heavily on all present, as does the knowledge that discovery by the Night's Watch could spell disaster for their mission.
conversation.topic: The challenges and dangers of scaling the Wall

key_characters.name: Jon Snow
key_characters.motivation: I'm deeply conflicted, torn between my oath to the Night's Watch and my growing bond with the wildlings, especially Ygritte. I'm acutely aware of the dangers this climb poses, both to the climbers and to the realm if they succeed. I must maintain my cover while grappling with my conscience and the potential consequences of this raid.

key_characters.name: Ygritte
key_characters.motivation: This is our moment to reclaim what rightfully belongs to the free folk. I'm excited and determined, but also concerned about Jon's loyalty. I need to ensure he's fully committed to our cause. I want to share the significance of this moment with him and gauge his reaction. Our success here could change everything for our people.

dialogues.message: The massive Wall looms before them, its ice glimmering in the early morning light. The forest presses close, offering cover for the wildlings.
[I can't believe they're actually going to attempt this.] (He watches the climbers prepare) They've done this before, every man of them.
[Jon seems conflicted. I need to keep him focused on our goal.] Aye, Jarl's no green boy. He'll have them over the top before the crows even know they're there.
[I should warn them of the dangers, but I can't blow my cover.] The Wall has its own dangers. Many climbers never make it to the top.
[He's worried about them? Or for the Watch?] That's why Mance chose the best. We're not crows to shiver and squawk at the first sign of winter.
[She doesn't understand the true peril.] It's not just the climb. If they're seen...
[He needs to stop thinking like a crow.] Then we fight. That's what we're here for, isn't it? To take back what's ours?
[I can't argue without raising suspicion.] (He nods silently, watching Jarl begin the ascent)
[Jon's silence worries me. I need to know he's with us.] When we cross, we'll be the first, Jon Snow. The first to see the lands beyond as free folk in thousands of years.
[The weight of my divided loyalties is crushing.] [If they succeed, everything changes.] Aye, the first. (He watches Jarl climb higher, his heart heavy with conflict)

plots.summary: Jaime Lannister, captured and mutilated by the Brave Companions, endures a painful journey to Harrenhal. He suffers from the loss of his sword hand and faces humiliation and physical torment. Upon arrival at Harrenhal, he encounters Roose Bolton and receives medical treatment from Qyburn, learning about recent events in the war.

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.description: A captured knight of the Kingsguard, son of Tywin Lannister.
key_characters.experience: Jaime struggles with the loss of his sword hand, enduring physical and emotional pain while being transported to Harrenhal. He maintains his wit and defiance despite his weakened state.

key_characters.name: Brienne of Tarth
key_characters.description: A warrior woman sworn to Catelyn Stark, captured alongside Jaime.
key_characters.experience: Brienne protects Jaime during their journey and faces potential assault from their captors. She remains loyal to her oath to return Jaime to King's Landing.

key_characters.name: Vargo Hoat
key_characters.description: Leader of the Brave Companions, a mercenary group.
key_characters.experience: Hoat is responsible for Jaime's mutilation and intends to ransom him for a large sum of gold.

key_characters.name: Roose Bolton
key_characters.description: Lord of the Dreadfort, currently holding Harrenhal.
key_characters.experience: Bolton receives Jaime at Harrenhal, displaying a cold and calculating demeanor. He provides information about recent events in the war.

key_characters.name: Qyburn
key_characters.description: A former maester now serving with the Brave Companions.
key_characters.experience: Qyburn treats Jaime's infected stump, preventing further damage but causing him great pain in the process.

conversation.scenario: The great hall of Harrenhal looms dark and imposing as Jaime Lannister, once proud knight of the Kingsguard, is brought before Lord Roose Bolton. Jaime's recent capture by the Brave Companions has left him mutilated, his sword hand severed. The journey to Harrenhal has been grueling, filled with pain and humiliation. The hall is tense with the presence of Frey soldiers and the mercenary Brave Companions. Jaime, despite his weakened state, struggles to maintain his dignity and gather information about the war and his family's fate. Lord Bolton, known for his cold demeanor, watches the proceedings with calculated interest.
conversation.topic: Jaime's capture, recent war events, and his medical treatment

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.motivation: Pain and fever cloud my mind, but I must stay sharp. I need to assert my worth, even handless. Cersei, where are you? I must learn what's happened in my absence. These Freys and Bolton - what game are they playing? I'll use my wit if I can't use my sword. They won't see me broken.

key_characters.name: Roose Bolton
key_characters.motivation: The Kingslayer's capture presents both opportunity and danger. His mutilation changes his value. How will Tywin Lannister react? I must gauge the situation carefully, reveal little, and determine the best course of action for my own interests. The war's tide is turning, and I must position myself advantageously.

dialogues.message: The great hall of Harrenhal is filled with an tense atmosphere as the captive Jaime Lannister is brought before Lord Bolton.
[I must show my prize to Bolton and secure my reward.] (Shoving Jaime forward) I give you the Kingthlayer!
[I won't let them see me broken.] (Stumbling but regaining his footing) A fury of Freys. Ser Danwell, Ser Aenys, Ser Hosteen. You have my condolences.
[Why is he offering condolences?] For what, ser?
[I'll show them I still have some power here.] Your brother's son, Ser Cleos. He was with us until outlaws filled him full of arrows. Urswyck and this lot took his goods and left him for the wolves.

[I must take control of this situation.] (Speaking softly) Can this be the Lord of the Dreadfort? When last I heard, my father had sent you scampering off with your tail betwixt your legs. When did you stop running, my lord?

[His silence is unnerving. I need to provoke a response.] (Feverishly) Can this be the Lord of the Dreadfort? When last I heard, my father had sent you scampering off with your tail betwixt your legs. When did you stop running, my lord?
[I'll not rise to his bait.] (After a long silence) You have lost a hand.
[I won't let him see my pain.] No, I have it here, hanging round my neck.
[This mutilation complicates matters.] (Reaching down and snapping the cord holding Jaime's hand) Take this away. The sight of it offends me.
[I need to know about Cersei.] Is there word of my sister?
[I'll give him some information, but not all.] She is well. As is your... nephew. (Pausing before saying 'nephew') Your brother also lives, though he took a wound in the battle.

plots.summary: This plot follows Davos as he is released from his cell and brought before King Stannis. It reveals tensions between various characters and provides insight into the current state of Stannis and his supporters.

key_characters.name: Davos Seaworth
key_characters.description: The main character of this section, also called the Onion Knight.
key_characters.experience: Davos is released from his cell and brought before King Stannis. He observes the changes in Stannis and considers his precarious position.

key_characters.name: Stannis Baratheon
key_characters.description: The king, described as looking much older and thinner than before.
key_characters.experience: Stannis greets Davos upon his arrival, showing some warmth despite his worn appearance.

key_characters.name: Axell Florent
key_characters.description: The castellan of Dragonstone and brother to Lord Alester.
key_characters.experience: Ser Axell attempts to manipulate Davos into supporting his bid to become Hand of the King, using threats and promises.

conversation.scenario: In the fortress of Dragonstone, Davos Seaworth has just been released from his cell and is being escorted to meet King Stannis. The castle is tense with political intrigue and the aftermath of a recent defeat. As they approach the Stone Drum, the central tower, Ser Axell Florent, the castellan, pulls Davos aside onto a bridge. The wind howls around them, and the sea crashes against the rocks below. Dragonstone's dark halls and ominous dragon statues loom in the background, creating an atmosphere of uncertainty and potential danger.
conversation.topic: Ser Axell's attempt to gain Davos's support

key_characters.name: Davos Seaworth
key_characters.motivation: Relieved to be free from his cell, but wary of the political situation. Concerned about his precarious position and loyal to Stannis, yet unsure of his standing. Anxious about the upcoming meeting with the king and suspicious of Ser Axell's motives. Determined to navigate the treacherous waters of court politics carefully.

key_characters.name: Axell Florent
key_characters.motivation: Ambitious and determined to become Hand of the King. Sees Davos as a potential ally or obstacle to his plans. Prepared to use both persuasion and threats to achieve his goal. Frustrated with Stannis's inaction and believes he knows what's best for the realm. Views this moment as a critical opportunity to secure his position.

dialogues.message: [I must convince this smuggler to support me. His word could sway the king.] The queen has urged my appointment. Even your old friend from Lys, the pirate Saan, he says the same. We have made a plan together, him and me. Yet His Grace does not act. The defeat gnaws inside him, a black worm in his soul. It is up to us who love him to show him what to do. If you are as devoted to his cause as you claim, smuggler, you will join your voice to ours. Tell him that I am the only Hand he needs. Tell him, and when we sail I shall see that you have a new ship.
[A ship could be my salvation, but can I trust this man?] (Davos remains silent, studying Ser Axell's face)

[His silence is not encouraging. I must press harder.] If you think to betray me, pray remember that I have been castellan of Dragonstone a good long time. The garrison is mine. Perhaps I cannot burn you without the king's consent, but who is to say you might not suffer a fall. (He grabs Davos by the neck and forces him against the side of the bridge) Do you hear me?
[I must tread carefully here.] I hear. (Thinks to himself: And you dare name me traitor?)

plots.summary: Tyrion Lannister awaits the arrival of the Dornish delegation led by Prince Oberyn Martell. He observes the various Dornish lords and their banners, noting the absence of Prince Doran. Tyrion greets Prince Oberyn and his companions, introducing them to his own party. As they ride towards King's Landing, Tyrion reflects on Oberyn's dangerous reputation and the potential for conflict his presence might cause, especially with the Tyrells in the city. Oberyn reveals to Tyrion that they had met before, many years ago at Casterly Rock.

key_characters.name: Tyrion Lannister
key_characters.description: A dwarf, son of Tywin Lannister, acting as representative of the crown.
key_characters.experience: Tyrion leads the welcoming party for the Dornish delegation, tactfully handling the introductions while internally worrying about the potential conflicts Oberyn's presence might cause.

key_characters.name: Oberyn Martell
key_characters.description: Prince of Dorne, known as the Red Viper, representing his brother Prince Doran.
key_characters.experience: Oberyn arrives in King's Landing with a large retinue, displaying a provocative and potentially dangerous presence. He engages Tyrion in conversation, hinting at their past meeting.

conversation.scenario: On the kingsroad outside King's Landing, Tyrion Lannister and his party await the arrival of the Dornish delegation. The air is tense with political implications as banners of various Dornish houses flutter in the breeze. Tyrion, a dwarf and son of the powerful Tywin Lannister, stands ready to greet the visitors on behalf of King Joffrey. The absence of Prince Doran is immediately noticeable as Prince Oberyn Martell, known as the Red Viper, leads the procession. The two parties meet under the watchful eyes of their respective retinues, each side wary of the other's intentions in this delicate diplomatic encounter.
conversation.topic: Introductions and welcome of the Dornish party to King's Landing

key_characters.name: Tyrion Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I must navigate this precarious situation with utmost care. Oberyn's reputation precedes him, and his presence could ignite tensions with the Tyrells. I need to be welcoming yet vigilant, ensuring smooth introductions while gauging Oberyn's true intentions. The weight of maintaining peace in King's Landing rests heavily on my shoulders.

key_characters.name: Oberyn Martell
key_characters.motivation: This dwarf represents the Lannisters, the family I hold responsible for my sister's fate. I'll play the diplomatic game for now, but my true purpose here goes beyond mere pleasantries. I must assess the political landscape, gather information, and find a way to pursue justice for Elia. Every word and gesture from the Lannisters will be scrutinized.

dialogues.message: [I need to make a good first impression.] (smiles and bows slightly) Well met, my lords. We had word of your approach, and His Grace King Joffrey bid me ride out to welcome you in his name. My lord father the King's Hand sends his greetings as well. (looks around with feigned confusion) Which of you is Prince Doran?

[He knows very well Doran isn't here. Let's see how he handles this.] (removes his helm) My brother's health requires he remain at Sunspear. Prince Doran has sent me to join King Joffrey's council in his stead, as it please His Grace.

[Just as I feared. This complicates matters.] His Grace will be most honored to have the counsel of a warrior as renowned as Prince Oberyn of Dorne. And your noble companions are most welcome as well.

[Let's see how he reacts to our full company.] (gestures to his companions) Permit me to acquaint you with them, my lord of Lannister. (proceeds to introduce each member of his party, including his paramour)
[A paramour? Cersei will not be pleased.] (maintains a polite smile) Not alone, my lords. That would be too enormous a task for a little man like me. (introduces his own party)
[We've made our presence known. Now to move things along.] My lord of Lannister, we have come a long dusty way, and rest and refreshment would be most welcome. Might we continue on to the city?
[Thankfully, a chance to end this tense encounter.] At once, my lady. (turns to Ser Addam Marbrand) Ser Addam, if you would lead the way.
[Time to rattle the Imp a bit.] (rides beside Tyrion) We have met before. I would not expect you to remember, though. You were even smaller than you are now.
[Stay calm. Don't let him provoke you.] When was this, my lord?

[Let's see how much he knows about that visit.] Oh, many and many a year ago, when my mother ruled in Dorne and your lord father was Hand to a different king. It was when I visited Casterly Rock with my mother, her consort, and my sister Elia.

[This could be dangerous territory. I need to tread carefully.] (nods thoughtfully) A queer time to come visiting. My mother had died giving me birth, so the Martells would have found the Rock deep in mourning.

plots.summary: Tyrion Lannister awaits the arrival of the Dornish delegation led by Prince Oberyn Martell. He observes the various Dornish lords and their banners, noting the absence of Prince Doran. Tyrion greets Prince Oberyn and his companions, introducing them to his own party. As they ride towards King's Landing, Tyrion reflects on Oberyn's dangerous reputation and the potential for conflict his presence might cause, especially with the Tyrells in the city. Oberyn reveals to Tyrion that they had met before, many years ago at Casterly Rock.

key_characters.name: Tyrion Lannister
key_characters.description: A dwarf, son of Tywin Lannister, acting as representative of the crown.
key_characters.experience: Tyrion leads the welcoming party for the Dornish delegation, tactfully handling the introductions while internally worrying about the potential conflicts Oberyn's presence might cause.

key_characters.name: Oberyn Martell
key_characters.description: Prince of Dorne, known as the Red Viper, representing his brother Prince Doran.
key_characters.experience: Oberyn arrives in King's Landing with a large retinue, displaying a provocative and potentially dangerous presence. He engages Tyrion in conversation, hinting at their past meeting.

[A paramour? Cersei will not be pleased.] (maintains a polite smile) Not alone, my lords. That would be too enormous a task for a little man like me. (introduces his own party)
[We've made our presence known. Now to move things along.] My lord of Lannister, we have come a long dusty way, and rest and refreshment would be most welcome. Might we continue on to the city?
[Thankfully, a chance to end this tense encounter.] At once, my lady. (turns to Ser Addam Marbrand) Ser Addam, if you would lead the way.
[Time to rattle the Imp a bit.] (rides beside Tyrion) We have met before. I would not expect you to remember, though. You were even smaller than you are now.
[Stay calm. Don't let him provoke you.] When was this, my lord?

[Let's see how much he knows about that visit.] Oh, many and many a year ago, when my mother ruled in Dorne and your lord father was Hand to a different king. It was when I visited Casterly Rock with my mother, her consort, and my sister Elia.

[This could be dangerous territory. I need to tread carefully.] (nods thoughtfully) A queer time to come visiting. My mother had died giving me birth, so the Martells would have found the Rock deep in mourning.

plots.summary: Arya witnesses the Brotherhood without Banners attack a group of Brave Companions at a septry. The outlaws, led by Lord Beric Dondarrion, defeat the Brave Companions and hang them, including Septon Utt. Lord Beric discusses his multiple resurrections with Thoros of Myr. Gendry decides to stay with the Brotherhood and is knighted by Lord Beric. The chapter ends with the unexpected appearance of Sandor Clegane.

key_characters.name: Arya Stark
key_characters.description: A young girl disguised as a boy, traveling with the Brotherhood without Banners.
key_characters.experience: Arya observes the battle and subsequent events, reflecting on the violence and the characters involved. She questions Lord Beric about resurrection and expresses concern about her own future.

key_characters.name: Beric Dondarrion
key_characters.description: The leader of the Brotherhood without Banners, who has been resurrected multiple times.
key_characters.experience: Beric leads the attack on the Brave Companions, discusses his resurrections with Thoros, and knights Gendry. He promises to return Arya to her family.

key_characters.name: Thoros of Myr
key_characters.description: A red priest who has resurrected Lord Beric multiple times.
key_characters.experience: Thoros participates in the battle and discusses his role in Beric's resurrections. He explains the process to Arya and emphasizes the power of R'hllor.

key_characters.name: Gendry
key_characters.description: A young blacksmith traveling with the Brotherhood.
key_characters.experience: Gendry decides to stay with the Brotherhood and offer his skills as a smith. He is knighted by Lord Beric, becoming Ser Gendry of the hollow hill.

conversation.scenario: In a dimly lit chamber of a remote septry, the aftermath of a fierce battle lingers. The Brotherhood without Banners, led by Lord Beric Dondarrion, has just defeated a group of Brave Companions. Bodies of the hanged, including Septon Utt, sway ominously nearby. The air is thick with the smell of blood and smoke. Arya Stark, disguised as a boy, stands with Lord Beric and Thoros of Myr, her young face etched with a mix of curiosity and concern. The recent knighting of Gendry has left a somber yet hopeful atmosphere. The trio gather to discuss weighty matters of life, death, and Arya's uncertain future.
conversation.topic: The nature of resurrection and Arya's return to her family

key_characters.name: Beric Dondarrion
key_characters.motivation: Weary from multiple resurrections, I feel the weight of my duty. The girl's safety is paramount, but our cause needs funds. I must balance our needs with her welfare, hoping to offer comfort despite my own doubts. Her innocence reminds me of what we fight for.

key_characters.name: Thoros of Myr
key_characters.motivation: The power of R'hllor courses through me, yet I'm acutely aware of its limitations. Beric's repeated resurrections concern me deeply. I must explain the process to Arya carefully, balancing truth with sensitivity to her young age and recent losses.

key_characters.name: Arya Stark
key_characters.motivation: Surrounded by death and strange magic, I'm both fascinated and terrified. Can they really bring back the dead? Is there hope for Father? I long for my family but fear rejection. Will they want me back, wild and unkempt as I am? I need assurances, but can I trust these men?

dialogues.message: [I need to know if there's hope for my father.] Could you bring back a man without a head? Just the once, not six times. Could you?

[Her innocence is touching, but I must be honest.] I have no magic, child. Only prayers. That first time, his lordship had a hole right through him and blood in his mouth, I knew there was no hope. So when his poor torn chest stopped moving, I gave him the good god's own kiss to send him on his way.

[The child's pain is palpable. I must offer some comfort.] Your father was a good man. Harwin has told me much of him. For his sake, I would gladly forgo your ransom, but we need the gold too desperately.
[I'm not sure if Robb will want me back.] (chews her lip) What if my brother doesn't want to ransom me?
[She fears rejection from her own family. I must reassure her.] Why would you think that?

[I'm not the lady I'm supposed to be.] Well, my hair's messy and my nails are dirty and my feet are all hard. I ruined that gown that Lady Smallwood gave me, and I don't sew so good. I don't sew very well, I mean. Septa Mordane used to say I had a blacksmith's hands.
[Her fears are unfounded. I must ease her mind.] (chuckles) Your brother will pay, child. Have no fear on that count.
[I need to be sure.] Yes, but what if he won't?

[I must make a solemn promise to reassure her.] (sighs) Then I will send you to Lady Smallwood for a time, or perhaps to mine own castle of Blackhaven. But that will not be necessary, I'm certain. I do not have the power to give you back your father, no more than Thoros does, but I can at least see that you are returned safely to your mother's arms.
[I need his word.] Do you swear?
[I will honor this vow with my life.] On my honor as a knight.

plots.summary: Bran, Hodor, Meera and Jojen arrive at an abandoned tower on an island in a lake. They enter the tower using a hidden causeway and take shelter inside. As night falls, they spot a lone rider approaching the village, who takes shelter in the ruins of an inn. Later, Jojen sees more armed men arriving in the village during a thunderstorm. The group grows anxious about being discovered.

key_characters.name: Bran Stark
key_characters.description: A young boy, son of Eddard Stark, crippled after falling from a tower.
key_characters.experience: Bran leads the group to the tower using knowledge from Old Nan's stories. He worries about being discovered but tries to remain brave. He accidentally wargs into Hodor briefly to quiet him during the storm.

key_characters.name: Hodor
key_characters.description: A large, simple-minded stableboy who carries Bran.
key_characters.experience: Hodor helps carry the group across the causeway and into the tower. He becomes frightened and agitated during the thunderstorm, requiring Bran to calm him.

key_characters.name: Meera Reed
key_characters.description: A young crannogwoman, sister of Jojen.
key_characters.experience: Meera scouts ahead for the group, helps them enter the tower, and tries to reassure Bran when men are spotted in the village.

key_characters.name: Jojen Reed
key_characters.description: A young crannogman with prophetic abilities.
key_characters.experience: Jojen senses the approaching storm and advises the group to take shelter. He spots the armed men in the village and grows concerned about their safety.

conversation.scenario: In a world torn by war, four unlikely companions seek refuge in an ancient, crumbling tower on a small island. As night descends and a fierce storm brews, Bran Stark, the crippled son of a noble house, leads his protectors – the Reed siblings and the gentle giant Hodor – to this precarious shelter. They've crossed a hidden causeway to reach this sanctuary, hoping to evade pursuers. But their relief is short-lived as they spot armed men gathering in the nearby village. The group now faces a harrowing night, trapped between the raging elements outside and the threat of discovery by potentially hostile forces.
conversation.topic: The threat of discovery and what to do next

key_characters.name: Bran Stark
key_characters.motivation: I must stay strong for the others, even though I'm terrified. We're so exposed here, and I feel helpless without my legs. I wish Summer was with us for protection. I need to prove I can lead, despite my fear. What would Father do in this situation?

key_characters.name: Jojen Reed
key_characters.motivation: The danger I foresaw is upon us. I must convey the gravity of our situation without causing panic. Our choices now are critical. I fear for our safety, especially Bran's, but I must remain composed to guide us through this peril. My visions have led us this far – what else might they reveal?

key_characters.name: Meera Reed
key_characters.motivation: We're in a precarious position, but we've overcome challenges before. My priority is protecting Bran and keeping everyone calm. I need to assess our defenses and possible escape routes. Jojen seems more anxious than usual – what has he seen? I must stay alert and ready for anything.

key_characters.name: Hodor
key_characters.motivation: Hodor hodor hodor. Big noise scary. Dark scary. Want to help friends. Don't know how. Bran safe? Meera safe? Jojen safe? Hodor keep them safe. How Hodor help?

dialogues.message: [I must warn them, but calmly.] There are men in the village.
[Is it just the man from before?] The man we saw earlier?
[I wish it were that simple.] Other men. Armed. I saw an axe, and spears as well. (His voice trembles slightly) I saw them when the lightning flashed, moving under the trees.
[We need more information to assess the threat.] How many?
[The situation is worse than I feared.] Many and more. Too many to count.
[Perhaps they're not as mobile as I feared.] Mounted?
No.
[Scary men outside. Storm loud. Want to help but don't know how.] Hodor. Hodor. Hodor.
[I'm scared, but I can't show it. I need to think of solutions.] What if they come out here?
[I need to reassure Bran and keep everyone calm.] They won't. (She sits beside Bran) Why should they?
[That makes sense, but I'm still worried.] For shelter.
[We can't dismiss the possibility. We need to prepare.] Unless the storm lets up. Meera, could you go down and bar the door?
[I've already considered our defenses.] I couldn't even close it. The wood's too warped. They won't get past those iron gates, though.
[We can't be complacent.] They might. They could break the lock, or the hinges. Or climb up through the murder hole as we did.
Lightning slashes across the sky, followed by a deafening clap of thunder.
[Loud noise scary! Must make it stop!] HODOR! (He claps his hands over his ears and stumbles in a circle) HODOR! HODOR! HODOR!
[We need to quiet Hodor before he gives us away!] NO! (He shouts) NO HODORING!
[We must calm Hodor before he alerts the men outside.] (She tries to catch and calm Hodor, but he's too strong)
[Panic rising] (He shouts at Bran and Meera) Shut him up!
[I have to do something! Maybe I can...] (He reaches out with his mind, attempting to warg into Hodor) Be quiet! (His voice is shrill and scared)
Hodor suddenly staggered and closed his mouth. He shook his head slowly, sank to the floor, and sat cross-legged.

plots.summary: Bran and his companions take shelter in an abandoned tower during a storm. They spot armed men in a nearby village, causing tension and fear within the group. Bran accidentally wargs into Hodor to quiet him when he becomes agitated by the thunder.

key_characters.name: Bran Stark
key_characters.description: A young boy, son of Eddard Stark, crippled after falling from a tower.
key_characters.experience: Bran tries to remain brave and decisive despite his fear. He uses his warging ability to calm Hodor when the situation becomes tense.

key_characters.name: Jojen Reed
key_characters.description: A young crannogman with prophetic abilities.
key_characters.experience: Jojen warns the group about the armed men in the village and grows increasingly concerned about their safety.

key_characters.name: Meera Reed
key_characters.description: A young crannogwoman, sister of Jojen.
key_characters.experience: Meera tries to keep everyone calm and assess their defensive options in the tower.

key_characters.name: Hodor
key_characters.description: A large, simple-minded stableboy who carries Bran.
key_characters.experience: Hodor becomes frightened by the storm and needs to be calmed by Bran's warging ability.

conversation.scenario: Night has fallen on the Neck, a treacherous swampland in the North. A fierce storm rages, with thunder cracking and rain lashing against an ancient, abandoned tower where Bran Stark and his companions have sought refuge. The tower, once a watchtower of the First Men, now stands as their precarious sanctuary. In a nearby village, armed men have been spotted, adding to the group's tension. The tower's stone walls barely muffle the howling wind, and occasional lightning flashes illuminate their worried faces. They're exhausted from their journey, hungry, and on edge, knowing they're in hostile territory with limited options for escape or defense.
conversation.topic: Dealing with the aftermath of Bran's warging and the ongoing threat

key_characters.name: Bran Stark
key_characters.motivation: I'm terrified but trying to be brave like Father would want. My warging ability scares me, especially after what just happened with Hodor. I need to understand these powers and use them to protect us. I'm worried about the armed men and feel responsible for everyone's safety. I want to prove I'm not just a burden because of my paralysis.

key_characters.name: Jojen Reed
key_characters.motivation: Bran's powers are growing faster than anticipated, which both excites and concerns me. I must guide him carefully while ensuring our immediate survival. The armed men pose a serious threat, and I'm calculating our odds of escaping undetected. I'm also worried about my sister's safety and my own weakening health. We must reach our destination soon.

key_characters.name: Meera Reed
key_characters.motivation: I'm on high alert, ready to defend the group if necessary. Bran's growing abilities worry me, especially their effect on Hodor. I'm torn between protecting my brother Jojen and fulfilling our mission to guide Bran. The armed men outside are a immediate threat, and I'm assessing every possible escape route. I feel the weight of being the group's primary protector.

key_characters.name: Hodor
key_characters.motivation: Hodor scared of loud noises. Head feels funny after Bran did something. Hodor not understand but trust Bran. Want to protect little lord but also want to hide from scary men outside. Hodor wish for quiet and safety. Hodor want to help but not know how.

dialogues.message: [I'm shocked and scared by what I just did.] (His eyes are wide with disbelief) What... what happened?
[This is a crucial moment for Bran's development, but we're still in danger.] You quieted Hodor, Bran. You entered him, like you do with Summer.
[I'm concerned for both Bran and Hodor.] (She looks worriedly between Bran and Hodor) Are you both alright?
[Head feels strange. Not sure what happened.] Hodor? (He looks around, confused)
[I feel guilty for entering Hodor's mind without permission.] I didn't mean to, Hodor. I'm sorry. (He turns to Jojen) I didn't know I could do that.
[I need to guide Bran, but also keep us focused on survival.] Your power is growing, Bran. But we can discuss this later. We need to stay quiet and decide what to do about the men in the village.
[We need a plan.] Could we slip away in the night? If they don't know we're here, we might be able to avoid them entirely.
